titleStmt.title: A Fuller answer to the moderatour, wherein his argument of advantage and disadvantage is so opened, as that he is laid open too, and made manifest to be an imposter, most grosly abusing king and kingdome. Worthy all men's observation, who, with an entire heart, wish peace to both.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed in the day of Jacobs trouble, and yeare of hope that he shall be delivered out of it,

notesStmt.note: A reply to Povey, Thomas: The moderator expecting sudden peace (1643).
Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
